channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Paramount merger with Skydance back on under new terms following collapse of talks
item.description: National Amusements, the family company that controls Paramount, will refer the deal to a special committee of Paramount directors for review.

item.title: Analyst Dan Ives raises Tesla price target to $300, sees $400 possible in 2025
item.description: Wedbush analyst Dan Ives raised his price target on Tesla after the electric vehicle maker posted better-than-expected deliveries in the second quarter.

item.title: U.S. first-time unemployment claims rise to 238,000
The ECB’s chief is tired of people blaming Taylor Swift for the Eurozone’s sticky inflation
item.description: “It’s not just Taylor Swift, you know,” Christine Lagarde told the ECB Forum. “Others have come as well.”

item.title: Hurricane Beryl breaks records in devastating path across the Caribbean
item.description: The hurricane has set a string of records that experts say are tied to climate change, as it developed faster and much earlier in the year.

item.title: U.S. trade gap is widest in 19 months
Even the Pentagon can’t completely freeze Huawei out of its operations
item.description: As it has done since the law was passed more than five years ago, the Pentagon is seeking a formal waiver to its obligations under Section 889 of the 2019 National Defense Authorization Act.

item.title: Private payrolls grew by just 150,000 in June, less than expected
item.description: Companies added 150,000 jobs for the month, below the upwardly revised 157,000 in May and the Dow Jones consensus estimate for 160,000.

item.title: U.S. economy generated 150,000 new private-sector jobs in June: ADP
The German railway system has become a ‘national embarrassment’ amid Euro 2024—and there seems to be no light at the end of the tunnel
item.description: German punctuality is well-known—but its railway service managed by Deutsche Bahn has struggled to follow it, hampering the fan experience at Euros 2024.

item.title: United Airlines is texting travelers live weather maps to explain flight delays
item.description: Even when it's bright and sunny, a thunderstorm hundreds of miles away can still disrupt flights.

item.title: Southwest Airlines adopts shareholder rights plan after Elliott discloses stake
Arise will pay $7 million to workers FTC says the gig company misled about how much money they could make on its platform
item.description: “Arise lured in workers with false promises about what they could earn while requiring them to pay out-of-pocket for essential equipment, training, and other expenses,” FTC Chairwoman Lina Khan said.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Paramount, Tesla, Constellation Brands and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in premarket trading.

item.title: Trump’s tariff plans could lead to five extra Fed rate hikes, Goldman says
